intro: Rabiea difformis, commonly known as the variable rabiea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or white, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Rabiea difformis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in temperate climates.
